intro: Brunfelsia obovata var. obovata, commonly known as the wax flower or night bloomer, is a tropical shrub native to South America. It features elliptic to obovate leaves that are glossy and dark green, often with a slight waxy coating. The plant produces striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to violet, opening in the evening and closing by morning. It thrives in warm, humid climates and prefers well-drained soil. Its unique blooming pattern and ornamental foliage make it a popular choice for tropical gardens.
